summary: The Save Affordable Housing Act of 2025 aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the low-income housing tax credit. The bill seeks to repeal the qualified contract exception, which currently allows owners of low-income housing projects to opt out of affordability restrictions under certain circumstances. It also outlines new procedures for existing projects and makes conforming and technical amendments. The effective date is the date of enactment, with specific rules for existing projects applying to requests submitted after enactment.
